You have come from the far north, from the lands of long-lost Angmar, after receiving tidings of the war to come. For years beyond count you and your folk have broken many dwarf shields with your axes and spears, crushed many broken bodies of men and elves below the claws of your fierce wargs, skinned the hides of the bear-people to wear as furs. The great halls of Gundabad in the Misty Mountains are now yours once again, as they were in the time of Bolg and Azog.^^Many of you have perished over the years, somemany of them slain in these very halls and tunnels - but many still remain. Great sport you have had with the greedy little diggers and their friends, in the past - and greater sport you will have now, when you march upon them and take everything for yourselves!^^Vengeance for Bolg, for Azog, for the Great Goblin - vengeance for the goblins of Gundabad!

Специальные клавиши: ^^ Клавиши построений:^ Шеренга - J ^ Стена щитов - K ^ Клин - L ^ Карэ - ; ^ Отмена построения - U ^^ Приказ сменить тип оружия - O ^^ Переключение типа камеры - CTRL+END ^^ Ралли - V ^^ Позвать лошадь - M ^^ Просмотр приказов / мини-карты - Backspace

Use the keyboard NUMBERS to select a division. Press 0 to select your entire force.^^Use F1-F4 to order selected divisions. Keep the F1 key down to place selected divisions. One may target an enemy division through this mechanism.^^Pressing the ENTER key often initiates an overhead Strategy Camera.^^Pressing the BACKSPACE key often initiates a Battle Command Display with 'radar.'

When ONE division is selected, the center of its front rank is placed at the spot indicated.^^When MANY divisions are selected, they are separated and spread out as if the player were standing at the spot indicated.^^One may memorize the placement of selected divisions relative to the player by pressing F2, F7. Default is infantry to the left, cavalry right, and ranged forward.

В Меню Битвы есть следующие формации:^^- РЯДЫ с сильнейшими бойцами спереди^- СТЕНА ЩИТОВ, ряды с щитами спереди и длинным оружием позади^- КЛИН с лучими бойцами на острие^- КВАДРАТ без определённого порядка^- БЕЗ ФОРМАЦИИ^^Даже в последнем случае, игрок может создать формацию до 4 рядов, приказывая ВСТАТЬ ПЛОТНЕЕ соответствующее число раз.
Great One, hold a moment! I would speak with you!
Hold a moment, Commander. I would have words with you. No, no, you need not kneel, even though you speak to one of royal blood.
Подожди. Ты. Я уже видел твое лицо. У меня был сон о тебе, но как это может быть ты ? Теперь, когда я увидел тебя своими собственными глазами, я осознал, что ты не больше чем жалкий червяк
Добро пожаловать в Медусельд, воин!
Приветствую, {playername}. Маэ гованнен!
Оставь меня в покое, {незнакомец/незнакомка}. Я не хочу с тобой разговаривать.
Кили, сын Двалина, к вашим услугам!
Добро пожаловать в Дэйл, путник! Чем могу вам помочь?
Тсс! Если ты будешь махать страже, я перережу тебе глотку и отдам варгам!
Ты!
A slave in stocks, bound for death, would speak with me? What have you to say?
Королевская кровь ? Ха! Что заставляет тебя думать, что ты имеешь хотя бы ее каплю
Look here, what do you mean by this, witch? Who are you?
Приветствую, моя госпожа. С кем я имею честь говорить?
Приветствую, эльфийский владыка! Большая честь - познакомиться с вами.
Неужели лесные эльфы приветствуют своих гостей именно таким образом?
{playername}, к вашим услугам. Как поживает народ Дурина?
Приветствую. Я размышлял{/а}, есть ли тут добровольцы, желающие присоединиться к нам в наших странствиях.
Придержи язык, урук, пока дело не дошло до мордобоя. Я не доносчи{к/ца}.
Кто ты?
I will not waste words on a slave bound for death.
Наглый болван. Уйди с дороги.
I have no time for your mad ravings, sorceress.
Прошу прощения, но у меня есть неотложные дела в другом месте.
Прошу прощения, у меня есть важный разговор ещё кое с кем.
Взаимно. Прощай.
Неважно. Мне нужно подышать свежим воздухом.
Неважно. Мы просто тут осматриваемся.
Тогда я просто пойду своей дорогой, а иначе мои пальцы начнут тянуться к рукояти меча.
[Проигнорировать и уйти]

I am no mere slave! I am a head-taking warrior, cheated of my rightful place among the ranks! You see that I am a woman, but I am stronger and swifter than many others, and I've outfought more men than I can count. The Pit Master - accursed be he! He set me a test, to fight three men at once. Three!

A small drop, to be sure, but my dam has told me all about my lineage. I am Heidrek, direct descendant of King Fengel, closer to the throne of Rohan and Dunland than any of our chieftains! Dark is my hair, but I fancy I have more than a strand of yellow in there somewhere.

In my dream, there was a tree. A tree, all of white. And you, you were there, standing beside it. You placed your hand upon its trunk, and lo, it withered down to its very roots. And the shadow in the sky lengthened, and the air grew heavy. I heard a laughter then, from far away in the east.
Меня зовут Гальмюне, и я считаю своим долгом знать ваше имя, {playername}. Позвольте объяснить, почему.

Вы могли слышать сказания о моих свершениях в битвах прошлого, забытых смертными людьми. И если смотреть с высоты времён, эта Война - лишь ещё одна опасность для эльдаров. Но всё же это будет Последняя Война.

Простите мне мою самоуверенность, незнаком{ец/ка}, но у нас тут редко бывают гости, а те, что приходят, не выглядят заслуживающими доверия. Всего лишь неделю назад, явился этот гном и... А, неважно. Меня зовут Луэванна, я из лесных эльфов Темнолесья.
Очень вежливо с вашей стороны интересоваться этим, {playername}. Мы отбиваем нашествия истерлингов и гундабадских орков, но пока мы и наши дэйльские союзники не можем с ними справиться.
Уверена, вы можете найти неплохих добровольцев, если поговорите с начальником казарм. Что до меня, то я просто лекарь и травница, и мои навыки весьма скромны.

Молодцом! Меня называют Гулм. Я выпустил кишки своему командиру, и теперь его снаги охотятся за мной.^Жалкая тварь, сам напросился. Однажды мы устроили засаду на разъезд соломенноголовых, а он всё прохлопал: закричал "Отступаем!" - и сбежал. Только Гулм и ещё несколько парней стояли непоколебимо и отбили конную атаку. А потом поколотили дубинками желтоволосых людишек, в мясо, хе-хе-хе. Если бы не мы, настоящие бойцы, всем бы быть едой для червей.
Я Дургаш!

I prevailed! I defeated them! But... one of them was so weak that he perished from the blows I dealt him. If he had been a simple bondsman, that would have been the end of it. But no. He was one of Great Lord Lurmsakun's many sons, by a lesser wife.

Well, you will not find any of Rohan or Dunland who will accept my claim, but it is a true one nonetheless. My grand-dam was a herdswoman, living in the hills, and one day it chanced that old King Fengel, the greedy grasping grandfather of Theoden the Pretender, happened to see her on the banks of the Isen. He took a fancy to her, and my dam was his child.

Do you not know before whom you stand? Ignorant fool. Know that I am Zigûrphel, of ancient Akallabêth - but like as not you know nothing of that name! Know, also, that I seek to redress the wrongs of long ago, the wrongs wrought upon me and my people by the spite of the Valar, they who sank our Great Armament and our home. Ah, Ar-Pharazôn, great and glorious! Shall your vision be unremembered evermore? No, not so long as Zigûrphel lives and has hands to do her work!

Я родилась в знатной семье и была придворной девой госпожи Эовин с тех пор, как мы ещё были маленькими девочками. Наши отцы были достаточно мудры, чтобы позволить нам постигать искусство боя наравне с нашими братьями, чтобы мы стали роханскими девами щита.
Владыка Эльронд отправил меня послом к владыке Келеборну, чтобы я предоставил ему помощь и совет. Здесь, в этой части Рованиона, это нужно.

Я люблю ходить тайными тропами нашего прекрасного леса. Иногда я беззвучно продвигаюсь меж деревьев и наблюдаю за жизнью лесных животных. Песня редкой птицы, логово дикого вепря - для меня всё это так же прекрасно, как звон оружия и великие чертоги для аданов.
Я помогаю в усилении эреборских укреплений, а также тренирую молодых гномов, под руководством моего досточимого отца Двалина. Таков наш обычай.
Я вылечила короля Бранда от запора, обычного недуга для людей, идущих на войну. Слабый отвар полыни - и сразу же и кишки, и ум приходят в норму.

И тогда я сказал себе: "Гулм, ты ведь не хочешь стать падалью?" И я ответил: "Нет".^Во время следующей битвы я отступил, прикинувшись раненым. Потом, пока никто не видел, я напал на своего командира! Почти разрубил его надвое, гарр! Потом хорошенько порезал его прихвостня-снагу...^^Но так вышло, что этот слизняк как-то выжил - и начал чесать языком обо всём этом. В следующий раз я уже постарался, чтобы он остался без башки, гарр...
Я волчий всадник Изенгарда и следопыт.

And so here I am, cursed at and spit upon, condemned to die for being mightier than the dogs who mock me! Free me, Great One. Free me, speak for me - and my strength is yours. My blade is yours. My life is yours!

Naturally, Chief Daeglaf and the rest wish to give me no chance at all for glory, for if I were to perform great deeds in battle, it would lend wings to my claim. Men would flock to my banner then! Your fame runs before you, Commander. If you will allow me to serve under your banner, I can perform those great deeds for you.

O Akallabêth, where are you now? Faded, all faded away... Where there once was light, the glory of our nation that was great above all others, now there is only the Shadow. My beautiful home now knows the eternal silence of the sea. But my heart is still full of fire, and dark beasts run wild within it. I know potent arts that you and your kind have never even imagined. Hearken unto me, now! Will you beg for my aid, as you should, or will you go from here skulking, like a worm? Choose swiftly!

Вам, наверно, известно, что женщины, даже обученные бою, не могут вступить в эоред. Однако я не думаю, что сидеть у домашнего очага и ждать возвращения мужчин с войны - моя судьба. Я не буду сидеть сложа руки, покуда в этой Войне можно совершать подвиги. И мне бы пригодилась ваша помощь, {господин/госпожа}.
Однако, поскольку враги Лотлориэна покуда отброшены, я думаю присоединиться к вам, {playername}. Я чувствую, что наши пути в этой Войне переплетены.

Думаю, вам этого не понять, вы же к войне готовитесь... Но вы, должно быть, много и далеко путешествовали - не доводилось ли вам видеть другие великие леса? Не могли бы вы взять меня с собой и привезти туда?

В войне сейчас наступило затишье, что плохо подходит гномьему воину с такими нравами и родословной, как у меня. Я так понимаю, вам придётся повстречать в ваших странствиях куда больше приключений, да ещё вы являетесь союзником гномов? Уверен, боец-гном значительно увеличит ваши шансы на выживание.

Я слышала, везде кругом полыхает война, но наши земли пока, к счастью, избавлены от этого. По царапинам на вашей броне я вижу, что вы много раз бывали в опасности. Может быть, мои скромные умения больше пригодятся в вашем отряде - и так будет лучше для всех нас?

Я бойцовый урук-хай, я берсерк! Всё, что нужно знать о том, как убивать людишек, я знаю. Я был в услужении у Белой Длани, но теперь Длань наверняка бросит меня в огненные ямы.^^Я пойду с вами и буду охотиться за людьми на юге, пока изенгардские снаги скрежещут зубами.
Наверно, вы можете стать моим новым хозяином.

I have been fortunate, I suppose, that Great Lord Lurmsakun has been occupied elsewhere. His intendants have left me here to rot. But my destiny is not to die as a prisoner! Have you come to grant me my rightful death on the battlefield?
Ho there! You have returned, as I knew you would. My hands are kept idle by my jealous chiefs. Let us speak, Commander! I would follow you, and fight in your ranks to win for myself renown.

You trouble my dreams still! Will you give me no peace? My dreaming eye sees deep and far. Here in Dol Guldur I still have visions of your works. I say this: if you were wise, you would have asked for my aid again ere now.
Всё больше всадников возвращается с ранами и увечьями, и я пытаюсь помогать им - там, где могу. Но я по-прежнему чувствую себя, как в клетке.
Вы передумали? Время эльдаров на исходе.
Пару дней я наблюдала за гнездом гигантских пауков. Поначалу они кажутся отвратительными существами, но всё же они не подпускают незваных гостей. Вы пришли, чтобы позвать меня с собой?
Строительство укреплений - достойное занятие для любого гнома. Но я бы хотел найти дело и для моей секиры. И поскорее. Давайте я пойду с вами.
Я нанесла ещё один визит нашему королю - на сей раз его рвало. Надеюсь, его решимость вступить в бой с врагом не повлияет на его режим. Режим надо сюблюдать. А вы не страдаете от запоров и рвоты?
Чем, по-вашему, я занимаюсь? Гулм просто сидит тут и ждёт, пока какой-нибудь подлый снага не пришьёт его в темноте. Возьмите меня с собой: я хорошо послужу вам.
Вы передумали? Я буду хорошо служить.
If you are truly as ferocious as you look, perhaps you could fight for me. After we feed you up a bit, of course.
ОЧень хорошо. Пока можешь сражаться на передовой ты можешь быть полезен, Дунландец
Strange way of asking to join me, witch. But very well, you may come along.
Я не откажусь от помощи роханской девы щита, буде таковая предложена.
Возможно, это прозвучит довольно нахально, но в моём отряде пригодились бы твои навыки. Особенно в свете грядущих битв.
Мы лишь странствуем по миру, но, чтобы защитить всё, что есть в нём прекрасного, нам приходится сражаться с врагом.
Разумеется, гномий воин нашему отряду не помешает.
Лекарь и травник нам бы пригодился.
Думаю, берсерк нам тоже будет полезен.
Да, я за тобой.
Pah! A murderous pit dog is not fit to be a companion of mine.
You talk of great deeds. Go and do some of your own, before you approach me again!
Pah! I'm guessing your bark is far worse than your bite. I have work to do!
Прошу прощения, сударыня, но мне нечем тебе помочь.
Я вернусь, когда Лотлориэн будет в меньшей опасности.
Нет, извини. Нам такие нахлебники не нужны.
Нет, извини. Мы и сами неплохо справляемся.
Нет, извини. Мы обращаемся к лекарям только тогда, когда они нам нужны.
Фу! Предатели мне не нужны.
Ты мне не нужен, раб.
Oh, to sink my teeth into meat again! You'll see my true mettle soon enough, once my hands and feet are free, and I have food in my belly!

Yes, you may call me that for now, for I am not ashamed of my Dunlending blood. My people have suffered greatly under the tyrant kings of Rohan, and I feel no small kinship with them. I will aid you in this war, and in all your efforts. But in return, Commander, you must help me press my claim when the time comes.

I will overlook your haughtiness for a time, but know that someday we shall have words. Perhaps by then, we shall both be standing before the Dark Lord, whom I once knew by a much different name, and then we shall see who has his ear. Perhaps then I shall teach you manners.
Она будет предложена с радостью, и вы можете принять меня в свой отряд, командир.
Понятно. Признаюсь, я наслышан о вас и ваших деяниях.
Мне не нравятся жестокость и оружие, но я знаю, как постоять за себя в этом хаосе.

Я умело обращаюсь как с секирой, так и с метательным топориком. Я могу также снизить ваши издержки, если вы позволите мне поговорить с торговцами за вас. И у меня верный глаз на лучшую добычу, какую можно снять с поверженных врагов на поле боя.
В самом деле? Ну, тогда мне только нужно забрать свои запасы трав и ворох рецептов.
Бойцовый урук стоит больше, чем все ваши снаги. Бойцовый урук никогда не бежит с поля боя.
Правда? Будет очень хорошо, если вы возьмёте меня на службу.
My mother once told me, I was born to hew many foemen. For you, I will slay many soft weaklings of the West. Only put a good blade into my hands, and I will do the rest!

I fight as my people do, like wolves in the night - I may fling a spear, or drive a pike into the chest of a charging horseman. Limbs I hew with axe or sword. With you, I will speak openly: I care not if you give more service to the Eye or the White Hand. It is all one to me, as long as I can sit my rightful throne in the Golden Hall.

But for now, let my lore and craft founded in long years be yoked to your service. Know this: with Zigûrphel's aid, you are as a dragon given its wings in the pit of Utumno. Great things I will do for you and your purpose, though you comprehend them not!
Я много охотилась с луком и метательным копьём. Я могу поохотиться на орков, под вашим руководством. Кроме того, у меня есть познания в целительстве, так что я вам пригожусь.
Возможно, присоединившись к вашему отряду и нанеся мощный удар там, где противник этого не ждёт, я смогу вывести Врага из равновесия. Я иду с вами.
Возможно, я смогу научить вас двигаться быстрее и тише. Пойдёмте.
Если вы сможете держать в узде всякий долговязый народ в вашем отряде, особенно презренных эльфов, то я с радостью присоединюсь к вам.
Должна вас предупредить, что я практически бесполезна в битве. Но я уверена, что вы сумеете обеспечить безопасность женщине моих лет.
Но вы решайте побыстрее, а то стражники начинают что-то подозревать...
Вы не пожалеете, что взяли меня.
I like your spirit. Very well, I will send word to Lurmsakun on your behalf.
Well, then, 'Prince', take up your weapons. You fight for me, now.
I hope, for your sake, that your words are not idle boasting. Do not disappoint me, Zigûrphel.

Я никогда не рисковал заходить так далеко, но слышал, как наши разведчики из Зеленолесья говорили, что здесь может быть Назгул. Я чувствую присутствие зла, но не могу назвать его имени. Оно очень сильно, так что надо быть готовыми ко всему.
Глядя на запустение и многочисленные орочьи следы, я начинаю опасаться за судьбу отважного Балина и его отряда. Похоже, Тень пала на Морию, и нам следует ступать как можно осторожнее.

Изредка какой-нибудь путешествующий купец прибывает в Дэйл и привозит на продажу самый вкусный мёд, какой мне доводилось пробовать. Купец ещё почему-то приговаривает, что "мёд сделан медведями", и смеётся.

Его проклятые стены слищком высоки и крепки, чтобы их можно было проломить моим молотом. Думаю, даже если мы прогоним людишек из их эдорасского свинарника, они всё равно сбегут сюда и спрячутся за этими стенами.
Вы знаете, что это за город?

Мне приятно идти за тобой, Великий. Вожди моего народа захотят снова получить эту землю, которая когда-то принадлежала им. Они смогут взять столько, сколько захотят, от Гондора и до Запада. Я же буду считать себя счастливым, если я смогу пролить как можно больше крови наших врагов на этой земле.

You will speak for me, won't you, Commander, when the long war is over? To whichever Power holds sway over the other - Eye or Hand? You will lend your voice to my claim, that I may hold Edoras and all Rohan in fief to an overlord, as my home and holding?

We shall crush the works of the Valar, of which these Dwarfs are a chief part, here in Middle-earth. Yes, it would be sweet to unmake what the Maker wrought. We will grind the Dwarves beneath our heels, shatter the last kingdoms of low Men, and laugh as the Elves fade into the mists like ghosts. Then the day will come when I stand before the Caves of the Forgotten, in Valinor, and call forth my king again!
Нам следует помнить великие деяния минувших дней и жертвы, что были принесены в ту пору. Союз Рохана и Гондора снова спасёт наши народы от гибели.
И пусть это будет напоминанием, что даже великие - даже один из истари! - могут отвратиться от верного пути и пасть. Те, кто жаждет властной силы, силой и будут сокрушены, так что не стоит мешкать.

Я чувствую, что злые воинства, скрывающиеся за его стенами, готовы выступить в поход... На прекрасный Лотлориэн? На Дэйл? На моё родное Зеленолесье? Не знаю. Но я прошу вас, сделайте всё, чтобы помешать им.
Если когда-нибудь судьба преподнесёт нам большое войско, то стоит рискнуть и войти в Морию - и вернуть её великие богатства.
Я чувствую сладкий запах множества цветов и вижу, как пчёлы собирают нектар. Если не возражаете, я бы собрала немного трав, они нам пригодятся. Это займёт совсем немного времени.
Не стоит тут шляться, если, конечно, за спиной нет целой орды урук-хаев. Ну, или если вы не хотите построить рожи дозорным на стенах.
Минас-Моргул. Место, где Назгулы пьют целыми днями, ха-ха!

Я был заключённым, приговорен к смерти за убийство сына Лурмсакуна в тренировочной яме. Трое из них напали на меня, и я их избил, но один умер от ран. Ты говорил от моего имени и освободил. Теперь я убью за тебя и умру за тебя, если понадобится.

Во мне течёт королевская кровь Рохана. Я клянусь - король Фенгель был моим дедом, хотя он и не брал мою бабушку в жёны. Вожди Дунланда завидуют мне и держат меня подальше от сражений, чтобы я не совершал никаких великих дел и не завоевывал славы и людей для моего знамени. Теперь, когда ты взял меня под своё знамя, я жду того дня, когда смогу сесть в Эдорасе на трон, который принадлежит мне по праву.

Что еще можно сказать, командир? Я практиковал свое искусство в тёмных глубинах Дол Гулдура. Мой мечтательный глаз видит глубоко и далеко, и я видел тебя и твои заслуги в этой войне. Мне кажется, я должен помочь тебе всем, чем только смогу, чтобы силы Запада потерпели неудачу, а силы Востока снова возросли и правили до конца времён.
Мне не кажется забавным, то, что вы так быстро это забыли.
Я удовлетворю ваше любопытство, но давайте не мешкать.
Я родилась и выросла в Темнолесье и принадлежу к лесным эльфам. Знание леса, присущее нашему народу, всем известно.
Я сын Двалина из народа Дурина.
Я врачевательница и травница из Дэйла.
Гулм расскажет вам, если вам нужно знать. Но разговорами врагов не убьёшь.
Буду краток.

By leave of the Lord of Gondor, I seek valiant confederates. Are there such in this place?

Nay, Commander. What valour we have is needed to defend our own walls. You may go to the barracks and find soldiers of courage and experience - mayhap more the former than the latter, I fear. Ever have we been traders, crafters and farmers. The finest of our soldiers go to the capital to enlist - perhaps you should try the White City.
Very well. I thank you for your counsel.
I thank you. May the good will of all good people go with you.

Why, Commander, there is one, and gladly shall I tell you of him; he is a gate guard, by the name of Cirdil, and even now I warrant you’ll find him at his rounds. He is dutiful and brave - but I spoke with him of late, and it seems to me he wishes to do more than simply stand his watch on the walls while the Shadow gathers beyond them. Surely he will be happy to venture out from the White City in your company.

Indeed there are. High in the esteem of our Captain Faramir are two of our commanders, Mablung and Damrod. Damrod is away at our Captain’s behest; but Mablung may be found in the cave yonder, a little way along this path here. We Rangers know much of woodlore and archery; Mablung stands above many of us. He is a man of prowess, and accounted one of our finest. Mayhap he will be given leave to accompany you for a time.
By leave of Theoden King, I seek the aid of valiant Rohirrim. Will any stout warriors here follow me?

It were better if you sought to bring aid, rather than asked for it. Horses, swords, spears - these things we need at present. As for your question: go to the barracks. There you will find those of our people willing to ride forth, such as they are - many beardless youths still, and still others unskilled herders and tenders of flocks.
I do take thought for your people as well, Thain. Farewell.
That counsel seems good to me. Health be with thee at thy coming and going!

Indeed, there may be. Dark indeed must the days become before our women ride out to war alongside the menfolk - yet our fearless and high-hearted Lady Eowyn, whom all love, rides and fights as well as any Marshal. Some shieldmaidens have trained with her from childhood, and several may be found around the Golden Hall. Hardy indeed are our women! Seek one called Galmyne - she is skilled in many arts of war, and goes about like a mare chafing at an ill-fitting bridle, for she has not been given leave to ride out with the men.
Elder, I seek aid. The least among the Elves of Lorien fight like heroes of old; will any here join my cause?

Evil has been seen and heard even here, among the mallorn-trees; sorrow has been known. In happier days we plucked the strings of harps; in these days we have indeed become skilled at the plucking of bowstrings. I cannot speak of heroes among us, but you should speak to the commander of our garrison here. Perhaps some few of our people may consent to join you for a time.
I had hoped for fairer words in this fair land of yours. But it shall be as you say, Elder.
I thank you for your counsel, Elder. Tiro ven Elbereth!

Nan Belain, here is a wonder indeed! At any other time I might have had naught but disappointment for you, but now in the company of the Lord and Lady of the Wood stands none other than the Lord Glorfindel, hero of more battles than even I can remember. I know little of such a great champion’s purpose here - he arrived with the host of Elrond, Lord of Imladris, and his own counsel he keeps, speaking only with Lord Celeborn and Lady Galadriel. Seek him out, Commander. Perhaps his cause may be joined to yours.
Your advice, good fellow - are there any warriors of remarkable prowess here?

Well, I don’t know about that. Your question isn’t very clear. What kind of “remarkable prowess” do you want that you can’t find among our garrison, I ask you? We fight with stout staves and sharp hatchets, we shoot well enough with bows. I don’t know what more you could ask for.
Well, then, I suppose I’d best be off. Good day to you, woodsman.
I see. Well, I shall look around for this “Dimborn”. Good day to you, woodsman.

Well, now, there’s a question. I’d say any of us could fight off a goblin or warg well enough, but our chief’s nephew is stouter than most. Spends most of his time just staring at trees, though. Or at nothing in particular. More thew than thought, if you take my meaning. Still, he’s gentle with his friends but fierce to his enemies, as one should be. Walks the woods as well as any Elf, I’d say. We call him Dimborn; not to be unkind, you understand, but we like calling things and people what they are. He ought to be around here somewhere.
By leave of Thranduil Elvenking, I seek champions of the Greenwood to fight in my command, Elder.

Indeed? Then you may ask those of our garrison, and mayhap some will be willing to follow you. But I sense your desire runs deeper than that. Do you fancy yourself a great hero, like those from Nargothrond or Gondolin of old? Our finest warriors are needed to guard against the growing shadow in Mirkwood. Take with you what soldiers we can spare, and be content.
Very well, Elder. As you say.
I thank you for your counsel, Elder. Navaer!

Indeed? There is one among us whose aid you should not despise. Luevanna is her name, and she is kin to me, as it happens. She is young, as our people reckon it, and has an abiding love for the woods and all the creatures in it, save those which are evil. Hers is a gentle spirit - she has not fought in our array. Still, I have a hope that she may be persuaded to follow you, for then she may come to learn that though we love peaceful ways in peaceful days, times of war call for warlike deeds. See, there she stands - you may speak with her. Harthon gerithach lend vaer!
Good master, I seek stout warriors of prowess to fight beside me in this war.

Well, now. Here in our town, we have always plied our trades and managed our affairs quietly, and not until recently have we had a great need for fighting men. I suppose you might ask at our barracks, and find what recruits you can from our garrison. I know of none among our captains here who would abandon his post to follow you.
I will do that, good master. Farewell to you.
Oft the unbidden gift proves the best value. I will speak to Faniul. Farewell!

Well, the King and his Lords have the best claim on the service of good captains. I don’t know that any of great renown are left to follow you - but are mere fighting men all you need? What about binders of wounds, versed in herblore? I know of one such - Faniul, personal healer to the King. She was midwife to my sister - and do not look askance at her age: she is of stout heart and sturdier than she looks. I warrant she’ll bear up well under the strains of travel. Why, I think I see her taking her ease over there, in this courtyard.
Good master, there seem to be some valiant warriors here. Will any follow my company?

Well, you’re not wrong, there, about our skill in battle, but aren’t our lads from our garrison here good enough for you? Apart from them, I don’t know anyone else who might satisfy you - you talk as though you were a king of some sort, looking for a great champion, like in the old days. Valiant is as valiant does, say I!
You needn’t get so annoyed, good master, I was simply asking. Good day to you.
That is excellent to hear, good master. Good day to you!

Oh ho! It’s warriors you’re after, are you? Then I have just the Dwarf for you: look for one Kili Goldfinger. A most excellent and audacious Dwarf he is, and a credit to his clan. Fights almost as well as a Longbeard, though he’s still fairly young as we reckon it. Quite good at story-telling, too, and he favours the cheerful sort of tale. Go and have a talk with him - I shouldn’t think he needs much persuading to follow you out into the wide world and do his bit for the war. Now, let me see… he’s not down here at the moment. Not the Great Chamber, either. The upper halls, perhaps - look for him there.

Not all our warriors here are blooded, but each of them is stronger and braver than any ten Dalishmen! Go and ask the arms master to see if he can spare any for you.
I ask for great warriors, and you show me drinkers of mother’s milk. Pah!
That is good to hear. Finally - a warrior with spirit!

Our greatest swordbearers and riders fight in the retinues of our warlords. But there is one who has found favour with none of our chiefs so far. Not because he is weak; far from it! He does not curb his tongue when he speaks, and he has spoken loudly against our chieftains, saying they are slow to act and over-cautious. If he had his way, I wager the countryside would be covered in flames by now. His name is Varfang, and he spends his hours training near the prisoner cages, not far from this tent.
All I see here is a rabble of treacherous skulkers, more likely to run than fight. Where are your proper warriors?

O ho! What do we have here? A great captain, are you? I reckon your bark’s worse than your bite, and no mistake. Orders are orders: you draw your troops from our garrison here, and that’s that. Keep talking like that where they’ve got ears to hear, though, and someone will stick a knife in your back one of these days, see if they don’t.
You’ll watch your words with me, if you know what’s good for you.
Scared witless by this woman, are you? I’ll go see if she’s all you make her out to be. This had better not be a waste of my time!

We’ve got stout lads aplenty, curse you. Ha… I know what you’re really after. Oh yes, indeed, I know just where you should go, Commander. See that cave over there, with steps leading down? If our boys get hurt badly enough we send them down there, and I reckon almost a third of them make it back up, har! They can do very strange things, down there… and that one in particular, the woman… she gives me the shivers, and that’s saying something. They say she’s got something to do with Number One, or even Higher Up, if you take my meaning. Talk to her, if you dare.
All I see here is a rabble of treacherous skulkers, more likely to run than fight. Where are your proper warriors?

Proper warriors, {she/he} says! I reckon any of our snaga could give any of your lubbers a good drubbing. We’re a tough lot, we are, and no mistake. Go speak to our barracks master - but speak with respect, mind, or you’ll not get our stout fellows to follow you. Knife you as soon as your back is turned, if you don’t speak proper.
I’ll speak how I like to the lot of you. I save my respect for those much Higher Up than your sort!
Garn! A sawbones, you say? Among this lot? All right, I’ll have a talk with him, but you’d better hope you aren’t telling me a crock of rubbish.

Ha! Losing more than you can keep, are you? Throwing our stout lads into the meat grinder, and then cursing when you find you haven’t got enough left to win your battles? A right splendid commander you are, oh yes. Very well - look over there! I’ll give you a helpful hint now, and you’ll remember it, yes? You see that fellow on the crates, the one with blood all over his hands, muttering to himself? Not much of a killer, but where’s the blood from, I hear you ask? Why, it’s the blood from some of our fighters he’s helped put back on their feet. He’s a sawbones, that one. You’ll see for yourself, the next time you lead your troops into another mess and find you need some stitching done.
I’ve heard about the fighting Uruk-hai. So far, I’m not impressed. Where are the greatest among them?

Leading patrols and armies of their own, no doubt - why would they lower themselves to fight under your command? They’ve got their own Orders to follow, from Higher Up. If you want fighting lads, go talk to the garrison chief! We’ve got stout fellows aplenty.
This rabble isn’t what you make it out to be. Stout fellows? Fighting lads? Snagas aplenty, more like. Slavering swine.
If he kills well, I’ll take him. If not, I’ll gut him like a fish. And if he does turn out to be just another worthless maggot, I’ll come back and pay you for wasting my time!

A great commander you are, it is plain to see, and wisely do you choose to take only the bravest and most skilled fighters under your banner. And yet, if you will take my counsel - a battle is won not merely with iron and sinew, Commander, but with guile and foreknowledge of the foeman’s doings, his comings and goings. We have a scoutmaster here, an Orc who has sworn allegiance to Saruman the Great. I have heard that he spent many years in the Misty Mountains, catching and taming wargs. A skilled tracker and hunter is Durgash. You will find him a most useful helper, Commander. He's usually lurking around the warg pits.

O ho! So you think our finest lads should humble themselves and take orders from you, do you? You’re a bold one, and no mistake. I know just the fellow for you. Calls himself Gulm, and he’s a proper fierce one, he is. Never seen anyone take so much pleasure in bashing in skulls and breaking bones with that mallet of his. And the more foes he kills, the more savage he seems to get. I don’t rightly know where he is at the moment, though - but he’s in this camp for sure, trying not to attract attention for some reason. Does that sound suitable for you, O Great Commander, taking an Uruk-hai berserker into your camp?
So, these are the Men of the hills who serve the White Hand! A sorry-looking lot. Where are your fighters of note?
Following those greater than you, no doubt. If you want warriors, speak to the training masters. See for yourself if any of our young pups will follow you into battle.
Curs and whelps! It is no wonder your people were driven into the hills by the men of Rohan.
A treacherous wolf, I would hardly keep by my side. But a tame hunting dog, I might consider. Let me see which one this Heidrek proves to be.

Despise us at your peril! Even a wretched cur will snap at your heels in a fight. We will have our vengeance on the Forgoil and their allies - and likely it will be Heidrek whom we’ll follow into Edoras. He’s a mongrel, that one - says he’s the grandson of a strawhead king, for all that he looks no different from any of us. He’s a terror in the training yard. If Chief Daeglaf doesn’t watch his back he just might find Heidrek’s spear in it one of these days. Maybe he’ll deign to follow you, if he thinks you’re worth his time. Look for him at the main campfire, where our chieftains stand.
Я слышал о великих войнах из этих мест. Где они ? Кто достоин присоединится ко мне ?

Those who have earned their death masks wish to follow commanders of still greater renown, but you may look for new recruits among our pitfighters and levies. Do not presume more than your station, Commander!
I ask for warriors and you show me pit slaves and unblooded peasants. Waste my time at your peril.
She sounds like a killer, right enough - but can her ferocity be leashed to useful purpose? We shall have to see.

So you want great warriors? We have them aplenty. But let me tell you of one whose savagery even we find astonishing. Her name is Turmbathu - yes, a woman! I would not have believed it myself had I not seen her in the fighting pit with my own eyes. Defeated three men at once, and killed one of them. Unfortunate, that - the one she killed was a son of Great Lord Lurmsakun, and so now you may find her among the prisoners, awaiting a painful death… unless you, Commander, can intercede. Such a pity, to waste such strength.
So, the people here fancy themselves heirs of greatness, do they? Can anyone here stand proof of such claims?

You come at the wrong time, Commander. Now we’re all basking in the glory of capturing this holding, and working out the equitable distribution of its wealth - to put it another way, the captains are all at one another’s throats, heated words are being said, and it will not be long ere blood of Umbar is spilled by Umbar hands. Some of the sailors are unhappy, and may consent to follow you instead of their former captains. That’s the best I can do for you at the moment, Commander.
Разочаровывающие. Но не неожиданно для морского пса. Я должен поискать где-то еще для нужного мне качества.
A corsair with a code of honour! Not unheard of, but not often found. I care only that he will go where I command, and kill as I instruct.

Why, if I guess aright you seek the finest fighters among us to join your ranks. After the recent burning of our Haven, I’m afraid our best sailors and raiders follow only our most experienced captains. But I have a friend, named Fuldimir, who has been passed over for promotion too many times, to my mind. It’s that strange way of thinking he has - he will not steal, he says, from any who still draw breath. Where’s the sense in that, I ask you? Still, he is handy with a cutlass, and as tough as any hardy seafarer. Here he is, in this tent - you may speak with him.
So, these are the finest in the Black Land, are they? Not much to look at. Tell me who’s actually useful in a scrap.

O ho, a mighty champion is here, I see! And of course, the mighty champion wants only the very best fighters, and no mistake! Well, well! Maybe you’ll find that some of the lads here have plans of their own, to rise high in the sight of the Eye. Maybe you’ll find Lugbúrz thinks a little better of them than of you. Won’t surprise me, ha! Why don’t you just go along to the barracks and requisition your troops like everyone else.
Oh, I’ll remember this slight, mark my words. Do me a good turn, and I’ll not forget it, but speak uncivilly to me, and you’ll soon see what I can do about that.
Well, I’ve struck a bit of luck at last, I see! You’ve done well. I’ll report your contribution.

You’ll want an Uruk for that, mark my words. The best fighters for sure in this sorry-looking lot. Now, if you’re looking for a trusty lad to watch your back in a fight, I’ll tell you straight: you’ll not find better than old Gorbag. Used to be a comrade of mine, before I got assigned here, a while after the Great Signal went up. Now that he’s off the patrol lists, he could join up with you right enough. He ought to be up there somewhere, by that big ruined Tower where the Bosses meet to talk sometimes. Looking down at the rest of these dunghill rats - he likes to do that, he does, ha!
Я слышал о великих войнах из этих мест. Где они ? Кто достоин присоединится ко мне ?

It is not accordant to our creed for our greatest to join with such as thee, O Commander. In the world, there are the great and the small; for soldiers such as ourselves, always we stand in this relation to one another. I counsel you to seek out those who could learn from you in battle; it is better not to try yoking a mighty stallion to a weakly-made plow, for the stallion would then destroy the plow, to the detriment of all.
Похоже, что ты не уважаешь меня, если я правильно понял. Я запомню это.
I see. I hope this Lykyada is as great a warrior as you say he is.

I heard a story around the fires: when the Black Serpent called his bannermen, who are some of our finest horse archers, many boasted of how all the treasures of the West would soon be theirs; but one whom we call Lykyada stood apart and remained silent. And when they asked him what he hoped to take from the West, he stooped, scooped up a handful of sand, and said, “What do I require that the land of my birth has not already given me? Behold, I make a gift to them of the sand on which I have stood.” And so saying, he let the wind from the east blow the sand away, into the west. Then all who heard this repented of their injudicious words, and swore to follow his lead. If he finds you worthy, Commander, he may follow yours. Look for him where he stands in attendance upon our chieftains.

All here at the Hornburg have their given duties, Commander - all save one, I should say. Maybe that one will ride out with you, for otherwise he should be lucky if another Éored will consent to have him! A drunken sot is our Ulfas - good cheer he brings to his comrades, and he is a skilled Rider, but loth is he to set down a tankard without first draining it! Look for him in the hall yonder, if that does not trouble you.
Elder, I seek the aid of renowned warriors, Man or Elf, from the fabled North.

Look well, Commander. Before you is perhaps the last great muster of the North, in this Age and any Age hereafter. Man and Elf alike, we who have come here do not hope to return. From the Last Homely House we have come; from the vales and forests of Eriador the last of the Núnatani, whom you call Dúnedain, have come. Each of us has his appointed tasks - none may follow you as you wish, save that you exercise your writ and recruit from our garrison.
